text: To identify sequences for inhibitor development , a selection of 14 - mer peptides from the MSP - MS library that underwent complete hydrolysis during the assay were compared using label - free quantitation of peptide cleavage kinetics ( Supplemental Figure 2 ) . Five - residue long peptides containing P1 - P4 ′ residues from primary cleavages in the library were synthesized and tested for their ability to prevent the cleavage of a fluorogenic alanine substrate by hAPN . From these initial peptides , only nHSPW was able to appreciably inhibit substrate cleavage with an IC 50 of 6 . 5 μM , whereas the remaining peptides all had IC 50 values above 500 μM ( Table 1 ) . Replacement of the P1 residue norleucine of nHSPW with either leucine or alanine did not have a significant impact on the IC 50 , resulting in low μM inhibitors . Complete removal of the P1 norleucine , resulting in the 4 - mer peptide HSPW , only decreased the potency of the inhibitor to 43 μM .
